segment.source: How to Make a Connection Group Ignore the Package Version
segment.target: How to Make a Connection Group Ignore the Package Version

segment.source: How to Make a Connection Group Ignore the Package Version
segment.target: How to Make a Connection Group Ignore the Package Version

segment.source: How to Make a Connection Group Ignore the Package Version
segment.target: How to Make a Connection Group Ignore the Package Version

segment.source: Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.1 lets you configure a connection group to use any version of a package, which simplifies package upgrades and reduces the number of connection groups you need to create.
segment.target: Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.1 lets you configure a connection group to use any version of a package, which simplifies package upgrades and reduces the number of connection groups you need to create.

segment.source: To upgrade a package in some earlier versions of App-V, you had to perform several steps, including disabling the connection group and modifying the connection group’s XML definition file.
segment.target: To upgrade a package in some earlier versions of App-V, you had to perform several steps, including disabling the connection group and modifying the connection group’s XML definition file.

segment.source: Task description with App-V 5.1
segment.target: Task description with App-V 5.1

segment.source: How to perform the task with App-V 5.1
segment.target: How to perform the task with App-V 5.1

segment.source: You can configure a connection group to accept any version of a package, which enables you to upgrade the package without having to disable the connection group.
segment.target: You can configure a connection group to accept any version of a package, which enables you to upgrade the package without having to disable the connection group.

segment.source: How the feature works:
segment.target: How the feature works:

segment.source: If the connection group has access to multiple versions of a package, the latest version is used.
segment.target: If the connection group has access to multiple versions of a package, the latest version is used.

segment.source: If the connection group contains an optional package that has an incorrect version, the package is ignored and won’t block the connection group’s virtual environment from being created.
segment.target: If the connection group contains an optional package that has an incorrect version, the package is ignored and won’t block the connection group’s virtual environment from being created.

segment.source: If the connection group contains a non-optional package that has an incorrect version, the connection group’s virtual environment cannot be created.
segment.target: If the connection group contains a non-optional package that has an incorrect version, the connection group’s virtual environment cannot be created.

segment.source: Method
segment.target: Method

segment.source: Steps
segment.target: Steps

segment.source: App-V Server – Management Console
segment.target: App-V Server – Management Console

segment.source: In the Management Console, select CONNECTION GROUPS.
segment.target: In the Management Console, select CONNECTION GROUPS.

segment.source: Select the correct connection group from the Connection Groups library.
segment.target: Select the correct connection group from the Connection Groups library.

segment.source: Click EDIT in the CONNECTED PACKAGES pane.
segment.target: Click EDIT in the CONNECTED PACKAGES pane.

segment.source: Select Use Any Version check box next to the package name, and click Apply.
segment.target: Select Use Any Version check box next to the package name, and click Apply.

segment.source: For more about adding or upgrading packages, see How to Add or Upgrade Packages by Using the Management Console.
segment.target: For more about adding or upgrading packages, see How to Add or Upgrade Packages by Using the Management Console.

segment.source: App-V Client on a Stand-alone computer
segment.target: App-V Client on a Stand-alone computer

segment.source: Create the connection group XML document.
segment.target: Create the connection group XML document.

segment.source: For the package to be upgraded, set the Package tag attribute VersionID to an asterisk ().
segment.target: For the package to be upgraded, set the Package tag attribute VersionID to an asterisk ().

segment.source: Use the following cmdlet to add the connection group, and include the path to the connection group XML document:
segment.target: Use the following cmdlet to add the connection group, and include the path to the connection group XML document:

segment.source: Add-AppvClientConnectionGroup
segment.target: Add-AppvClientConnectionGroup

segment.source: When you upgrade a package, use the following cmdlets to remove the old package, add the upgraded package, and publish the upgraded package:
segment.target: When you upgrade a package, use the following cmdlets to remove the old package, add the upgraded package, and publish the upgraded package:

segment.source: RemoveAppvClientPackage
segment.target: RemoveAppvClientPackage

segment.source: Add-AppvClientPackage
segment.target: Add-AppvClientPackage

segment.source: Publish-AppvClientPackage
segment.target: Publish-AppvClientPackage

segment.source: For more information, see:
segment.target: For more information, see:

segment.source: The example XML file, Connection group XML file with optional packages, in this section: How to Use Optional Packages in Connection Groups
segment.target: The example XML file, Connection group XML file with optional packages, in this section: How to Use Optional Packages in Connection Groups

segment.target: How to Manage App-V 5.1 Packages Running on a Stand-Alone Computer by Using PowerShell
